body: in the attached demo file, the split building mass component only processed a few of the masses for the lower floors of the building. May I ask what is causing the problem? Thank you! [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/jawJtYwsNnyqiu58JhklKD349ss*OFwZf2o7fu9ncs8MnVvvvjTOGyZ8qZN6ROVf*MfpJnu0I9HocnyOWD7zXajcq1gJsQSa/03.PNG) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/jawJtYwsNnwaA*wk8GjJtbgMwkJB89wMYA8S7qgtZ5RMYGMoOljc6pUzEP*KTR66vwj8LbI3j7ZJW72AR5eRVYuR8mo7WLjZ/04.PNG)
topic: [solved] split building mass component works for only a few masses

replies.body: it seems the workflow only works for the first 9 massing .... Appreciate if you can kindly advise! [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/jawJtYwsNnxN-Pmj26ll3w3ZB5ly*ncLTeyEqzM0C7xsoEVoZ5AB0xHSTpHuDzrtccSrYDF55A0dgLT542yTXEnoMN6irHR8/05.PNG)

Hi Grasshope, I have analyzed your file, for some wierd reason, Honeybee's component cannot read 4 breps correctly as can you see on the image below. And they cause problems. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/jawJtYwsNnyV3aGknWVH2dpDq9HO-rLzPXL*5tUNFrMrLeBLc01ui7MCbYXhUewH-7xKsNDcC7UbTH2kRPaL5LkVf08kiyfa/ERROR.png) I have modified and simplified your script using cap function and now it works fine. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/jawJtYwsNnzuX03Mw6iSMaauEEbbl2OgVbv73lrWEW483edpZhCGV8ZDIcUlHPXq08mFP1zmQ*zF*ljeRCGX2YfWu2JhKVhm/FIX.png) You could make a script that changes height of section planes inside a range so the height of floors change, too. Bests Antonello

Noted with many many thanks, Antonello!



I learn a lot from your suggestions!



I'll try to test the model for E+ simulation.
Thanks Grasshope and Antonello. I think we should log this as a bug or as an enhancement request on github.

Hello Everyone,

Sorry for being so late here.  I have put in a bit of code to stop the component from failing and you can find this in the attached file.

Still, I wish I could make this component work in all cases but, as I mentioned in the tutorial video, it is not going to be possible to make a component that will work for all cases (there were just too many bugs in Rhinocommon that came to the surface when I was writing this one).

One thought that I have had is to separate this component into one that splits masses into floors, which I know can be written to never fail, and another that splits flors into core/perimeter, which won't work in all cases but I can get better control over the failures this way.

Let me know if this will be helpful and I will add it to the github issues.

-Chris
